      • getNodesOrThreads

        public static org.eclipse.emf.common.util.EList<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification> getNodesOrThreads(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification instanceOrThread)
        This method returns a list of nodes (or threads) to which the passed instance is allocated. It is based on MARTE Allocation (a stereotyped abstraction) which is a generic mechanism to deploy UML elements to nodes.
        Parameters:
        instanceOrThread - The instance for which we like to know the allocation information
        Returns:

      • getNodes

        public static org.eclipse.emf.common.util.EList<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification> getNodes(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification instanceOrThread)
        This method returns a list of nodes to which the passed instance is allocated. If the instance is allocated directly to a node, this node is returned. If the instance is allocated to a thread, the allocation of the thread to a node is returned.
        Parameters:
        instanceOrThread - The instance that should be deployed
        Returns:

      • updateAllocation

        public static org.eclipse.emf.common.util.EList<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Node> updateAllocation(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification instance,
                                                                                            org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification oldNode,
                                                                                            org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification newNode)
        This method updates (and optionally removes) the allocations of an instance
        Parameters:
        instance - The instance that should be deployed
        oldNode - the old node allocation
        newNode - the new node allocation, may be null to indicate removal
        Returns:

      • getAllNodesForPort

        public static org.eclipse.emf.common.util.EList<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification> getAllNodesForPort(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification instance,
                                                                                                               org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Port port)
        Retrieve a list of nodes to which the instance is allocated to *or* to which one of the contained instances is allocated to (recursively)
        Parameters:
        instance -
        A - port of the composite. Contained instances are examined only if they have a connection with this port.
        Returns:
        a list of nodes

      • allocate

        public static boolean allocate(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification instance,

      • propagateNodesViaPort

        public static void propagateNodesViaPort(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification instance,
                                         org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Port port,
                                         org.eclipse.emf.common.util.EList<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification> nodes)
        Assign node name to leafs
        Parameters:
        instance -
        A - port of the composite. Contained instances are examined only if the have a connection with this port. If null, no sub-instances are examined
        nodes - A list of nodes to which leafs are allocated

      • getStartPort

        public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Port getStartPort(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Class component)
        Return the start Port of a component, i.e. a port that corresponds to the "magic" port name start and is typed with the interface IStart
        Parameters:
        component - a component implementation
        Returns:
        The start port or null
